answers.answer: hi...and welcome, that is really strange. I read a few sites on diabetes and insulin and couldn't find any info that you are seeking...I will include one site I refer too often, but I'm sure you already know all that...http://www.marvistavet.com/html/insulin_administration_in_the_.htmlI will also include a site where we have a Veterinarian on to reply however sometimes the replies take a few days, I would consult the Vet your kitty see's regularly. perhaps he is having a reaction to the insulin?please let us know what your able to find out. and good luckhttp://www.medhelp.org/forums/Animal-Health---General/show/112?controller=forums&action=show&id=112&camp=msc

question: My diabetic cat has been coughing when I give him his second shot at night.  Its either at night he coughs or in the morning.  He coughs with his head stretched out and lasts a minute or two.  He has been eating, drinking water, no change in litter box and plays the same.  There were two nights I couldn't give him his night shot and he never coughed that night or next day.  Why is this happening?
title: cat cough
